title: A Covid Contact-Tracing Contrast Lays Bare China’s Inequalities
sub_head: Itineraries produce starkly different pictures of life in Beijing; migrant worker’s tale sparks outpouring of sympathy
body:
HONG KONG—Two Covid-19 contact-tracing efforts in China’s capital have combined to open a window into extreme inequality that has engrossed many in the world’s most populous country.
On Jan. 15, health authorities in Beijing reported on the recent movements of a Covid-19 patient they described as a professional woman. A portrait of the type of life led by the city’s wealthy elite, the itinerary showed her skiing in the suburbs, shopping at Christian Dior and Lane Crawford, and eating at a well-known Peking duck restaurant.
